modules.description: Generates cryptographically secure random numbers using hardware-based entropy sources like RDSEED and RDRAND, as well as timer-based methods inspired by the Whirlwind RNG paper. It operates on byte sequences and unsigned 64-bit integers to produce random data. Used to seed cryptographic primitives in secure unikernel environments where hardware support is available.

Provides functions to manage entropy sources, connect and disconnect from entropy providers, and register or remove handlers for source events. Operates with types representing entropy sources, handlers for data events, and tokens for handler management. Used to dynamically monitor and interact with entropy generation systems in real-time.
